Might have to put a Super Radio on my Christmas list. I have an Older Ge S=
uper Radio.
 
 Frank-S


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: vfp19968@retrocom=
.comDate: Fri, 16 Nov 2007 04:02:15 -0800Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Oh Bruce...=





The Superadio III is now marketed under the RCA name and widely availa=
ble. The circuit board kit (function generator) is also widely available at=
 low cost ($10-$12) and only requires minor modifications to the circuit. A=
nyone who can operate a screwdriver and a soldering iron can do the whole c=
onversion including purchasing the radio and function generator for under $=
100, for themselves. Here is an example from a modified Superadio III using=
 the FM band. "Their talking about Tesla" Dave --- joecioppi@... wrot=
e: From: "joseph a. cioppi, sr." <joecioppi@...> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogro=
ups.com Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Oh Bruce... Date: Fri, 16 Nov 2007 02:34:55 =
-0500 Dear Frank Sumption and Fans of Random Broadcast Vocals, I'm complete=
ly indebted to Frank for receiving the inspiration for Frank's Box and his =
hard work leading to working boxes for experimenters use. I'm sure all this=
 open access to his schematics and results inspired me to use a scanning ty=
pe FM receiver for Joe's Box. The success had with both types of boxes supp=
orts the idea of random functions in our world contain intelligence that ca=
n be extracted as intelligible messages. In my case, the curiosity of Steve=
 Hultay and the timely transfer of his hard earned funds to finance parts c=
reated the economic conditions needed. I can see that wide spread productio=
n of communicator hardware will take funds. However, a nice clone of the ol=
d GE Super Radio produced currently in China is ideal to apply a scanning t=
uning voltage. These sets are retailing for $35-$45. The mini-box is certai=
nly overpriced and poor by comparison. Joecioppi P.S. Hi Frank On Nov 15, 2=
007 10:46 PM, Frank Sumption <franks-boxes@...> wrote: > Yep, and b=
y not wanting to sell this stuff, and at least gettting > enough to pay for=
 parts & materials it kinda deprives ohters form using > it----BUT----I'm j=
ust one person, this other outfit seems to have someone to > put the things=
 together. > > Frank > > > ------------------------------ > To: EVP-ITC@yah=
oogroups.com > From: erick_hunter9@... > Date: Thu, 15 Nov 2007 16:29=
:14 -0800 > > Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Oh Bruce... > > *Thank you, Frank! The=
re you have it! The last time I checked, the U.S. > of A. was a "Capitalist=
" country...! That simply means making or buying > wholesale a product that=
 will retail for more money than was invested thus > making a Profit. You w=
ant an example? You just have to look at Thomas > Edison and Nickola Tesla.=
 Both were brilliant men, pioneers in their > field, which was basically th=
e same for both. One was more brilliant than > the other, in turn the less =
brilliant "stole" ideas and products from the > other. The most brilliant w=
as not a "Capitalist", he devoted his time and > efforts to "bettering the =
lives of mankind". The lessor was indeed a > "Capitalist", his motives were=
 less noble, however, and he was willing to > "better" mankind, too, but ma=
ke a good profit in the process. We all know > the story...one is foremost =
in the eyes of the general public, became > personally rich and famous, whi=
le the other died broke and without > fanfare. A shame, but factual, none-t=
he-less. Would you work for free? > Would you supply people with something =
they want without recompense? I > think not. I certainly wouldn't! Get real=
. Bruce is going to post a > capture, he says, from Nickola Tesla. I predic=
t that it will be a > warning... "Don't Do What I Did! Make a Profit!" --Ro=
d * > * * > ** > ** > ** > ** > > *Frank Sumption <franks-boxes@...=
>* wrote: > > Well...Mean Bitch week was last week, so I was trying to be n=
ice. Yeah, > I can make a box for like $50 if it's on perf board, and $100 =
if it on PCB, > the bare board alone is about $46. The only problem I have =
is the time. It > takes two weeks minumum to get a box together and working=
. Most people would > like to get paid for their time. I make about $40 an =
hour at my real job. ( > been here 24 years!) Someday this stuff will get m=
ass produced in China, and > be included in every cell phone! > > > Frank-S=
 > > ------------------------------ > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com > From: w=
arrior18eii@... > Date: Thu, 15 Nov 2007 08:54:53 -0800 > Subject: Re=
: [EVP-ITC] Oh Bruce... > > I realize the time it takes to put things toget=
her. Especially units > built from the ground up but if you are taking on t=
he duty of spreading the > technology to help mankind, to me it would be a =
labor of love. I can see and > accept recovering production costs even, but=
 this guy is looking to make a > huge profit. > > You gained your respect a=
nd credibility on the fact that you have a system > that works and you are =
willing to give it away when you didn't have to > Frank. This guy is coming=
 out of the gate with a cheap imitation of EVP > maker and your system (bot=
h of which are free) and putting a huge price tag > on it. It just don't si=
t right with me! > > Honestly, I know it is none of my business what Ron do=
es but I guess I > just needed to register my protest with this seemingly b=
latant attempt at > exploiting good though naive people. > > Regards, > > F=
rank R. > > ----- Original Message ---- > From: Frank Sumption <franks-boxe=
s@...> > To: evp-itc@yahoogroups.com > Sent: Thursday, November 15,=
 2007 10:17:20 AM > Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Oh Bruce... > > > Interesting. I=
 can see the price for early models. This stuff take tons > of time to put =
together. I don't want to fault anyone ---yet. I couldn't > figure out how =
to sell the things, and keep it honest, but all that does is > deny everyon=
e from using it. > > Frank-S > > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com > From: warri=
or18eii@ yahoo.com > Date: Wed, 14 Nov 2007 19:43:51 -0800 > Subject: Re: [=
EVP-ITC] Oh Bruce... > > $400 to $650 dollars a unit. This guy is retarded!=
 If he is selling this > unit, he doesn't get it Frank! > > Frank R. > > --=
